results.title: David and his mother (from David Copperfield)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Tales from Charles Dickens”.
Excerpts from Charles Dickens’ “David Copperfield”. Describes the early years of David Copperfield from his life with his widowed mother and servant Peggotty, through his adjustment to his mother’s marriage to Mr Murdstone, until the time of his mother’s death and his enrolment at boarding school.

results.title: David and Hazel: a story in communication
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Balla, ONF | NFB and John Howe
results.brief_description: A study of what may happen when a husband insulates his job from his family. David believes that what happens at work is his sole concern. Hazel has grown to accept her husband’s estimation of himself as a breadwinner and of herself as homemaker, and does not expect his confidences when things go wrong. A neighbour voices quite different views about the sharing of family problems. When David’s job is threatened, it is from this neighbour that Hazel hears of it. Her worries, added to David’s, trigger a chain of reaction of bruised feelings. Presented as a case study for discussion on family relations.
results.title_for_label: David and Hazel: a story in communication

results.title: David and Dora married (from David Copperfield)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Tales from Charles Dickens”.
Excerpts from Charles Dickens’ “David Copperfield”. Tells how David and Dora’s idyllic existence begins to wane after their marriage because of Dora’s childlike inexperienced management of the household. Records the disastrous dinner for the uncomplaining Traddles, and the couple’s first quarrel. Shows how David’s acceptance of Dora’s ineptness affords them some final months of happiness before her death.

results.title: David and Dora (from David Copperfield)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Tales from Charles Dickens”.
Excerpts from Charles Dickens’ “David Copperfield”. David’s courtship of Dora is marked by great tenderness, amusing misunderstandings and treachery by Miss murdstone, who has re-appeared as Dora’s maid. Due to his aunt’s financial distress, it looks as though David will never marry Dora. But fate intervenes, and when Dora’s father dies leaving her penniless, David and Dora are free to marry.

results.title: David and Betsey Trotwood (from David Copoperfield)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Tales from Charles Dickens”.
Excerpts from Charles Dickens’ “David Copperfield”. Shows the change in Betsy Trotwood’s feelings toward David Copperfield, from her outrage at the time of his birth to her protectiveness of David against the unpleasant Murdstones some years later, in spite of her dislike of donkeys and small boys.

results.title: David
results.creator_credit: Religious Film Society and Steve Mason
results.brief_description: David Ellis, a 19 year old physically and mentally handicapped person, shares his relationship to everyday situations. The effect of his disability on family and personal relationships. A strongly religious film.

results.title: David
results.creator_credit: Tom Kelly and Canadian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man Alive”.
David is a young actor with Down’s Syndrome, chosen to portray a mentally handicapped adolescent in a Canadian television play. Points out society’s unwillingness to accept potential from those with Down’s. David speaks about his condition to a school class and is shown skating, swimming, jogging and cycling, and interacting with family and friends. Suitable for middle and upper secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: David
results.creator_credit: James Carr, World Wide Pictures, BFI and Paul Dickson
results.brief_description: Illustrates the harsh reality of life in a coal mining town using documentary and fictional techniques. Made in Ammanford, Wales, the film recounts the life of Daffyd Rhys employed as a caretaker for the local school following a coal mine explosion. The story is related by one of the school’s former pupils and covers Daffyd’s early life in the coal mines, his courtship and marriage, his work as a poet, the death of his son, and his life at the school. Most of the roles are performed by the people of Ammanford resulting in a realistic portrayal of life in the Welsh coal mining community. The film was presented as Wales contribution to the Festival of Britain.

results.title: Dave Jones and his Giant Puppet
results.brief_description: Dave Jones is an animator who moved to Natimuk about 2001, follow him as he works on an ambitious live projection project involving a 14 metre high puppet, which will be suspended from the town grain silos.
